[Skip to main content](https://support.checkfront.com/hc/en-us/articles/19868064659484-How-do-I-add-a-payment-link-to-our-email-notifications#main-content) * * * Learn how to add a payment link to email notifications with our step-by-step instructions, including adding [URL](https://support.checkfront.com/hc/en-us/articles/19868064659484-How-do-I-add-a-payment-link-to-our-email-notifications#h_01HCR20Z7FKVNH75EA3HQHPFRG) or [text](https://support.checkfront.com/hc/en-us/articles/19868064659484-How-do-I-add-a-payment-link-to-our-email-notifications#h_01HCWHDY7RNHD6D0NDATTW8C1H) links using email variables. * * * ## **Accessing the features mentioned in this article** **Where can I find this feature using the top menu?** Manage > Notifications > Email > Email Notification **What more do I need to use this feature?** - [Admin](https://support.checkfront.com/hc/articles/19868502205212) or [restricted](https://support.checkfront.com/hc/articles/19868490374428) permissions to _Manage Notifications_. **Which Checkfront version supports this feature - classic items, classic products, or both?** - This feature is available in both our classic version using classic items (Inventory > Items) and our classic version using classic products (Inventory > Products).  → [Learn more about products](https://support.checkfront.com/hc/articles/19868100241052) * * * ## Adding payment links to email notifications [Back to top](https://support.checkfront.com/hc/en-us/articles/19868064659484-How-do-I-add-a-payment-link-to-our-email-notifications# "Back to top") | | | | --- | --- | | ![attentive](https://support.checkfront.com/hc/article_attachments/19868064529820) | **Expert Tips from Checkfront Support: Asking for payment through an email notification**
_"Do you need to send a Customer a link to pay a booking deposit? Adding links to email notifications using email variables is a good way to do this!"_ _**\- Jordan, Technical Support Lead**_ | Would you like to provide an easy way for Customers to pay for a booking directly from an email you send them? You can display the URL directly in the email or as a text link using email variables. This is an excellent option if you don't require Customers to pay at the same time they book or want them to pay a remaining balance! | | | | --- | --- | | ![FAQ](https://support.checkfront.com/hc/article_attachments/19868076624924) | **What are email variables?**
Email variables are elements you can add to email messages that are automatically filled with information once received by the recipient. For example, you can add a payment link to bring Customers to your booking payment page.
There are two payment variables available:
- _{$BOOKING\_PAYMENT\_URL}_ links to the payment page for a booking. If no balance is due, this redirects to the receipt page.

- _{$BOOKING\_PAY\_FULL\_URL}_ links to the payment page for a booking. This requests the full payment from the Customer even if a deposit is still owed. If no balance is due, this redirects to the receipt page. | | | | | --- | --- | | ![Note](https://support.checkfront.com/hc/article_attachments/19868076634268) | The notification payment link differs from the Pay Now Link option, which adds a button to the Booking Invoice for Customers to click and pay the remaining balance.
Find out more here:
- [Managing Booking Invoice layout options](https://support.checkfront.com/hc/articles/19868417230748) | | | | | --- | --- | | ![Attention](https://support.checkfront.com/hc/article_attachments/19868064559132) | Adding a payment link to a notification after you accept bookings does not update previously sent emails. Instead, this change applies to notifications sent going forward that have the link included. | | | | | --- | --- | | ![Learn More](https://support.checkfront.com/hc/article_attachments/19868092735388) | Learn more about email notifications email variables here:
- [Introduction to email notifications](https://support.checkfront.com/hc/articles/19868151287964)
- [Working with variables in email notifications](https://support.checkfront.com/hc/articles/19868320326300) | * * * ### Adding URL links [Back to top](https://support.checkfront.com/hc/en-us/articles/19868064659484-How-do-I-add-a-payment-link-to-our-email-notifications# "Back to top") ![Notifications Payment Link](https://support.checkfront.com/hc/article_attachments/19868076668188) You can include a payment URL directly in notification emails. Follow these steps: 1\. Navigate to the **Notifications** area (Manage > Notifications). 2\. Click **\+ New Notification** to create a new notification or select an existing entry to edit it. 3\. Add one or more of the accepted variables in the Email section under the HTML tab, such as _{$BOOKING\_PAYMENT\_URL}_ or _{$BOOKING\_PAY\_FULL\_URL}._ 4\. After you finish setting up the notification, click **Save**. ![Notifications Payment Link Text](https://support.checkfront.com/hc/article_attachments/19868108640540) When the email is delivered to the Customer, the variable automatically converts to a URL link the Customer clicks to bring them to the booking payment page to complete payment. * * * ### Adding text links [Back to top](https://support.checkfront.com/hc/en-us/articles/19868064659484-How-do-I-add-a-payment-link-to-our-email-notifications# "Back to top") ![Notification Payment Variable Email Phrase](https://support.checkfront.com/hc/article_attachments/19868092780188) You can include a text link in notification emails. Follow these steps: 1\. Navigate to the **Notifications** area (Manage > Notifications). 2\. Click **\+ New Notification** to create a new notification or select an existing entry to edit it. 3\. Highlight a word/phrase in the email content, e.g. _Click here to pay now_. 4\. Click the **Link** menu button and then click **Insert Link**. 5\. In the window that shows, place the variable in the **URL** field, such as _{$BOOKING\_PAYMENT\_URL}_ or _{$BOOKING\_PAY\_FULL\_URL},_ and click **Insert**. 6\. After you finish setting up the notification, click **Save**. ![Notifications Payment Link Phrase](https://support.checkfront.com/hc/article_attachments/19868076757404) When the email is delivered to the Customer, the variable automatically converts to a text link the Customer clicks to bring them to the booking payment page to complete payment.
